noun.description: A projecting support of stone or brick built against a wall.
A source of defense or support.
examples: there was a demand for a new stable order as a buttress against social collapse

verb.description: Provide (a building or structure) with projecting supports built against its walls.
examples: we buttressed the wall as it was showing signs of cracking and collapse

verb.description: Increase the strength of or justification for; reinforce.
examples: authority was buttressed by religious belief

origin: Middle English: from Old French (ars) bouterez thrusting (arch), from boter to strike or thrust (see butt).
